properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 8 at 9:54AM PST until January 8 at 10:56PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning has ended for the following rivers in
Washington...

Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County
Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County
Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and Thurston
Counties
Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County
Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County
Snohomish River At Snohomish affecting Snohomish County

Significant, widespread rainfall ended last night and most rivers
are now receding, except for the lower Chehalis River. Flooding will
end on all rivers tonight except for the Skokomish and lower
Chehalis Rivers. More precipitation in on tap for Friday into
Saturday of 1 to 2.5 inches. However, the snow level over the
Cascades will be too low for storm runoff to cause any flooding.
Over the Olympics, the snow level could reach 3000 to 4000 feet and
could be enough to stall the Skokomish River from falling below
flood stage or send it back up above flood stage if it is below by
then.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Snohomish River At Snohomish
* Until this evening.
* At  9:00 AM Wednesday the stage was 24.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 25.0 feet.
* Fell below flood stage this morning.
* No additional flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river fell below flood stage at  5:15 AM Wednesday
and will continue to fall. Flooding will continue in some areas
until the flood wave has completely passed downstream to the Puget
Sound.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
